tspan.tspan: The sum of the weights of all paths of length
starting at the initial state, where each path is multiplied by the weight of its
visits that state infinitely often and zero otherwise.

text.tspan: A diverging language L is a pair of maps of the form:
No precondition on X or Y:
Precondition: Both X and Y contain only finite words
sum of X(l)Y(r) for all l and r such that lr = w
Precondition: X contains only finite, non-empty words
Precondition: X contains finite words and Y contains infinite words
X(xi) is non-zero for all i
X(x1) X(x2) ... X(xk) for all x1x2 ... xk
= w[0,n] where w[n,] is in X
The set of rational diverging languages
is obtained by starting with the finite
weighted languages, closing them over the
rational operators just presented and then
taking only the words of infinite length.
A bi-diverging language L is a map of the form:
A rational bi-diverging language is a bi-diverging language formed
from the juxtaposition of two rational diverging languages.
Bi-diverging languages can be formed from the juxtaposition of
The weights of a (finite) walk through
an automata is the product of all
the factors along the path multiplied
by the weights of the final state.
For an input word w and integers m and
to the sum of the weights of all walks
through the automata for the word
w[-m,n] that start on an initial state that
the full infinite word visits infinitely often
to the left and ends on a state that the
full infinite word visits infinitely often
